title: Sketch Class: The Portrait—Line, Form, and Expression
short_description: Multi-session sketch class over six weeks
header_description: This program is currently sold out. To be added onto the waiting list, please email museum-programs@artic.edu.
description:
Six Saturdays
March 9–April 13
10:45–12:45

This class is for people ages 16 and up.

Explore history and technique of portraits through a variety of media and from different historical periods from Renaissance to Pop. Some prior drawing experience is recommended, though not required.

Multi-session sketch classes offer the chance to draw in the museum's galleries under the guidance of experienced instructors. All materials will be provided. Although all levels are welcome, participants in this particular course may find it helpful to have some experience with drawing.

Click here to see all upcoming sketch classes and workshops. For additional information, please call (312) 443-3680 or email museum-programs@artic.edu.

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an e-mail to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
